Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Category: COSMETIC AND MEDICAL EQUIPMENT AND IMPLEMENTS
Name: Vase for cosmetics
Description: Vase for cosmetics with slightly a truncated body, cylindrical neck, protruding disc-shaped base and a wood inlay pattern on the shoulder: juxtaposed wooden triangles forming a decorative band 8 mm in height. There are traces of textile on the bottom and of cosmetic paints on the inside, as well as traces of white cosmetic paint on the rounded section.
